prompt:
Nurse: That's okay, Mr. Benton. There's no rush. Whenever you feel ready to start, that's the right time. Now, let's move on to your blood pressure. When was the last time

Patient: Maybe.

Nurse: I understand, Mr. Benton. It's a new habit

Patient: Tomorrow.

Nurse: That's a good start, Mr. Benton. Tomorrow, when you wake up, try to remember to check your blood sugar. Now, let's move on to your blood pressure. When was the last time you took your blood pressure measurement?

Patient: I don't know.

Nurse: That's okay, Mr. Benton. It's important to keep track of your blood pressure. Can you recall the last time you checked it?

Patient: No.

responses.gpt4: I'd like to recommend, for your best health, to regularly monitor your blood pressure due to your condition.  Would you be open to including this in your daily routine from now on?
responses.our_model: That's alright, Mr. Benton. If you don't have a record of your last blood pressure measurement, it's a good idea to take it as soon as you can. Do you have a blood pressure cuff at home?
